SEARCH

Class Room

java.lang.Object
Room
public class Room extends Object
Class Room - a room in an adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. The exits are labelled north, east, south, west. For each direction, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room, or null if there is no exit in that direction.

      public String description
      The room's description.

    • exits

      private HashMap<String,Room> exits

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room(String description)
      Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".
      Parameters:
      description - The room's description.

  • Method Details

    • setExit

      public void setExit(String direction, Room neighbor)
      Define the exits of this room. Every direction either leads to another room or is null (no exit there).
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the exit.
      neighbor - The room in the given direction.

    • getExit

      public Room getExit(String direction)
      Return the room that is reached if we go from this room in direction "direction". If there is no room in that direction, return null.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the exit.
      Returns:
      The room in the given direction.

    • getExitString

      public String getExitString()
      Return a description of the room's exits, for example, "Exits : north west".
      Returns:
      A description of the available exits.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Return the description of this room.
      Returns:
      The description of the room.

    • getLongDescription

      public String getLongDescription()
      Return a string describing the room's long description, of the form: You are in the kitchen. Exits: north west.
      Returns:
      The long description of the room.
